physical_appearance: The image depicts a settee. The frames of the settee are made of a wooden material and it is brown in colour. The cushions on the seat and back have tiny holes arranged in straight lines. The design on the frame of the sette, at the centre, is of the shape of a scallop. On either side of the scalloped shape, there are symmetrical wave patterns and a scroll motif. The legs of the settee are designed to be paw feet. There are no visible tears or cracks in the paintwork of the settee.
sgcool_label_text: "This settee belonged to Paul Victor Emanuel Warnars (1876-1940) and his wife Maria Warnars-Krol (1885-1930). Warnars was involved in the tin mining industry, living an working in Muntok, which was at that time the capital of the Dutch Indies Bangka-Belitung Residency. The settee is made of Amboyna wood, and was of a style popular across Dutch and British colonies in the 19th century. It bears the influence of the early 19th century ""Grecian"" sofas designed by Thomas Sheraton."
subject_terms_1: chairs (furniture forms) Dutch Colonial wave pattern scroll (motifs) paw feet
